_header: To the honour of God one in persons three
Note:
Printed Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, pp. l-106.
_description: Thomas Norton, Ordinal of Alchemy — 3102 lines in seven chapters and a prologue

BodAsh57.First Lines:
To the honor of God one in Persones threethis booke is made that
                    lay men shold it seeand Clerkes also after my deceasewhereby all
                    laymen which put them selfe in prease…
BodAsh57.Last Lines:
…in the yeare of Christe M. CCCC. seauentie and seauenethis
                    worke began Honor to God in heauene
BodAsh57.Note:
Written by Ashmole on an unnumbered leaf the start of the MS:
                    ‘John Dee Anno Domini 1577. This following Booke (called Norton’s
                    Ordinall) was transcribed by the hand of Dr. John Dee, and had been bound in
                    purple velvet’. On p. 123 is the index of ‘Authors recitede in this
                    booke’.

BodAsh1441.First Lines:
Of rude people which delen with this werkesTen Thousand Laymen
                    against ten able Clerks…
BodAsh1441.Last Lines:
…In this yeare of Christ 1470 & seavenThis worke was
                    begun, Honor to God in heaven
BodAsh1441.Note: Last 12 lines only; at the end: ‘Finis’.

BodAsh1445.First Lines:
To the honor of god oen in parsons threThis bewerke is maede
                    þat Laye men shullde hit se…
BodAsh1445.Last Lines:
…in þe year of cryeste 1477this worke bygan honor to gode
                    in heauen
BodAsh1445.Note:
Incomplete: a leaf containing the conclusion of the
                    ‘Prohemium’ is lost. At the end:
                    ‘Explicit’.

BodAsh1451.Transcription:
Remember that water will bubble & boileBut butter shoulde simper
                    & also oyle and so, with longe Labour wasteand not with bublinge
                    made in haste
BodAsh1451.Note:
4 lines, extract. In the margin: ‘Norton Cap
                    4’.

BodAsh1464.First Lines:
To the honor of god one in persons threethis booke is made that
                    laie men should it see…
BodAsh1464.Last Lines:
…In the yeare of Christe 1000 foure hundred & seavenThis
                    worke beganne honnor to god of heauen
BodAsh1464.Note:
At the end of the Ordinal; in the margin:
                    ‘1477’.

BodAsh1479.First Lines:
To þe honor of god one in persons threthys boke is made
                    þat laye men shold yt se…
BodAsh1479.Last Lines:
…in þe yere of chryste 1477thys work was begonne honor to
                    god in heaven

BodAsh1490.First Lines:
To the honour of god on in persons threeThis bocke is made that
                    laie men it should see…
BodAsh1490.Last Lines:
…in the year of christ 1447This worcke be gane honor to god of
                    heaven
BodAsh1490.Attributed Title:
Liber Thome Norton hic incipit (f. 277). Explicite and nowe laste
                    copied out bi me Simon Forman, 1591. March the 23. student in Astronomy and
                    Phisick & Arte nicromantike (f. 288v). The English Preface to the
                    Ordinal follows the poem on f. 289 with a title ‘Norton 1447’ and is
                    subscribed with a colophon by Forman

BodeMus63.First Lines:
To the honour of god one in persons threethis booke is made that
                    lay men shoulde it see…
BodeMus63.Last Lines:
…In the yere of christe Ml CCCC seventi & seventhis werke
                    begane honour to god in heuen

CamTCC910.First Lines:
To the honour of god one in persons threethis boke ys made that lay
                    men shulde yt see…
CamTCC910.Last Lines:
…In the yere of Christ a ml cccc seventie &
                    sevenThis werke beganne honour to god in hewen
CamTCC910.Attributed Title:
Claudes secreta (top margin f. 1, added by later hand); Prohemium
                        libri qui intitulatur Ordinatio secretorum (f. 1)

CamTCC1119.First Lines:
To the honor of God one in persons threeThis book is made that lay
                    men might it see…
CamTCC1119.Last Lines:
…In the yeare of Christ 1470 and seauenThis worke was begunne
                    honor to god in heauen

CamTCC1269.First Lines:
To the honor of god one in persons threethis booke is made that
                    laye men scholde it see…
CamTCC1269.Last Lines:
…in the yeare of Christ 1477this woorke began onour god in
                    heaven
CamTCC1269.Note:
Followed by epilogue, ‘This booke vnto Clarkes declareth science
                    greate…suche graces greate shall haue as he thought not to fynde’ on
                    ff. 39v-40.

BLAdd10302.First Lines:
To the honour of god in persones þreeThis boke is made
                    þat lay men shuld it se…
BLAdd10302.Last Lines:
…Thus endith the subtile werk with al hire storeIt nede not I
                    may not I will shewe no more
BLAdd10302.Editions:
Reidy,  John,
                        ed.  
             Thomas Norton’s The Ordinal of Alchemy.
EETS
         o.s. 272 (1975): 1-78, 81-83 (lines 1-2502, 2623-2682).

BLHar853.First Lines: To the honor of god one in persons threthis booke is made that lay men should it see…
BLHar853.Last Lines: …In the yere of Christ Ml CCCC seaventie & seaventhis worke began honour to God of heaven

BLSl1873.Editions:
Reidy,  John,
                        ed.  
             Thomas Norton’s The Ordinal of Alchemy.
EETS
         o.s. 272 (1975): 78-81, 83-96 (lines 2503-2622, 2683-3102).

LincInnH90.First Lines:
To the honour of God one in persons threeThis booke is made that
                    Low men shold it see…
LincInnH90.Last Lines:
…All other blewes the sadder þer they beThey haue lesse
                    of slyer but more terrestirelye…

Wellcome580.First Lines:
To the honour of god one in persons threethis Booke is made
                    þat lay-men should it see…
Wellcome580.Last Lines:
…All þat haue pleasure in this booke to readepray for my
                    soule & for all quicke & deadin the Yeare of Christe
                    McccclxxvijThis work was begoon honour to god in heaven.Soli beo
                    Honoret gloria
Wellcome580.Note:
Ends imperfectly in the 5th chapter. Seventeeth-century
                    hand.

TCD684.First Lines:
To the honor of God one in persons threeThis booke is made that
                    laymen should it see…
TCD684.Last Lines:
…As would haue bene his chapter of the fireAnd meruell not
                    Lordes ne ye freendes all
TCD684.Attributed Title: Norton his Ordinall of Alchemie (top f. 2)

EDULaiii164.First Lines:
To the honour of god oone in parsones threThys boke ys made
                    þat laye one shuld ytt se…
EDULaiii164.Last Lines:
…In the yere of Christ ml cccc seventy &
                    sevenThis warke biganne honour to god of heven
EDULaiii164.Note:
With epilogue, 5 couplets, ‘Putrifaccion most desstroy &
                    deface…’.
EDULaiii164.Attributed Title:
Ordinall of Alchymy (p. 129 by later hand); Liber Thomas Norton (p.
                    129, by later hand)

BosHistSoc.First Lines:
…Who wolde haue trewe worke he may no labowre spareNether yet
                    thys purse though he make it Bare…
BosHistSoc.Last Lines:
…These be þe sayenges of NortonIn hys booke the Ordynall
                    thereComprehendyng þe trew circulacionOf elementes in euery degre
                    & mayner…
BosHistSoc.Note: Extract of 20 couplets plus one cross-rhymed quatrain.

Reidy (1975)
